text: [Well-known Texas pastor Terry Turner reflects on ministry, legacy as he enters retirement](https://www.baptistpress.com/resource-library/news/well-known-texas-pastor-terry-turner-reflects-on-ministry-legacy-as-he-enters-retirement/) MESQUITE, Texas (BP) – Terry Turner stepped down from the pulpit of the church he founded, Mesquite Friendship Baptist, in the fall of 2023. His formal retirement, however, simply signaled a change of vocation, not a cessation of labor. [Infamous 1927 ‘Santa Claus Robbery’ provides go-to spiritual lesson for Texas pastor](https://www.baptistpress.com/resource-library/news/infamous-1927-santa-claus-robbery-provides-go-to-spiritual-lesson-for-texas-pastor/) AUSTIN, Texas (BP) – Many Central Texas natives know the story of the infamous “Santa Claus Robbery” that took place two days before Christmas 1927 in the Eastland County town of Cisco. [Renewed commitment to prayer leads Texas church’s transformation](https://www.baptistpress.com/resource-library/news/renewed-commitment-to-prayer-leads-texas-churchs-transformation/) TROUP, Texas (BP) – Preston Lindsey has worn a lot of hats in his lifetime. He’s been a logger, pipe-fitter, oil field roughneck, telephone lineman, and a shipping manager and transportation director for a grocery chain. He spent 15 years as an agriculture teacher with the Troup Independent School District before becoming its director of support services, a position he holds today. [Fort Worth pastor tries to make every day a ‘kidney day’](https://www.baptistpress.com/resource-library/news/fort-worth-pastor-tries-to-make-every-day-a-kidney-day/) FORT WORTH, Texas (BP) – Rudy Kebreau and Randal Lyle are bound by far more than their mutual faith and pastoral calling these days. Lyle, senior pastor at Meadowridge Community Baptist Church, gave Kebreau, his next generation and children’s pastor, a priceless gift this summer when he donated a kidney to his friend and associate. [Texas church ‘saw something’ in inexperienced, ex-felon pastor](https://www.baptistpress.com/resource-library/news/texas-church-saw-something-in-inexperienced-ex-felon-pastor/) NEW HOME, Texas (BP) – New Home Baptist Church gave Pastor LJ Wright a chance in 2019. Since then, the congregation’s faith has produced fruit – despite the pandemic and the pastor’s own tragic personal loss. [Young mom finds new life in Christ, new church home](https://www.baptistpress.com/resource-library/news/young-mom-finds-new-life-in-christ-new-church-home/) CEDAR HILL, Texas (BP) – Haevanle (pronounced heavenly) Satterfield prayed for God to send her a church home in 2021. The 27-year-old single mom had gotten a New Testament from a Little Free Library box at the Cedar Hill park where she had taken her young son. [DR chaplaincy teams offer ‘spiritual counseling’ at FEMA request](https://www.baptistpress.com/resource-library/news/dr-chaplaincy-teams-offer-spiritual-counseling-at-fema-request/) FORT MYERS BEACH, Fla. (BP) – One Hurricane Ian survivor found dealing with the pressures of the storm and the storms of life almost unbearable … until she spoke with Southern Baptists of Texas Convention Disaster Relief chaplains at Fort Myers Beach. [‘Brother, I need a hug’: SBTC DR volunteers sharing love of Christ in wake of Hurricane Ian](https://www.baptistpress.com/resource-library/news/brother-i-need-a-hug-sbtc-dr-volunteers-sharing-love-of-christ-in-wake-of-hurricane-ian/) FORT MYERS, Fla. (BP) – The Southern Baptists of Texas Disaster Relief volunteers working at McGregor Baptist Church serving Hurricane Ian survivors had a 5,000-gallon truck full of potable water and plenty of electricity from generators to power the mass feeding unit they operated. [Dallas church bringing Gospel to thousands through food ministry](https://www.baptistpress.com/resource-library/news/dallas-church-bringing-gospel-to-thousands-through-food-ministry/) DALLAS (BP) – For Johnnie Bradley, pastor of Shiloh Missionary Baptist Church for the past 16 years, the struggles of the pandemic meant increased opportunities to share the Gospel by expanding the church’s longtime Messiah Ministry outreach. [Salado church destroyed by tornado rises over adversity to continue ministry](https://www.baptistpress.com/resource-library/news/salado-church-destroyed-by-tornado-rises-over-adversity-to-continue-ministry/) SALADO, Texas (BP) – Tornadoes can hit with an unheralded ferocity.
